hieros

𓅐 Muta Gaia

𓅐 Mutter Erde (mother earth𓇾 Modder) Musen
𓅐 Mother Nature 𓈖𓏏𓂋𓏯𓅐 ⲛⲟϣⲉⲣ = vulture n-sh-r
𓅐 Mut = Mutter (mother) 母 mǔ
𓅐 Mother nurture 𓄟𓄠𓋤 mnais
𓅐 Gaia 1. Geier (vulture) 2. Earth (geo)
𓇾 Mutar Mörtel Modder = Erde ⇔ Terra monde Ur-mound𓏠𓇹𓇺
𓅐 Mutaas kargas carrion-eater 𓅓𓏱𓏏 vulture Foul-Tier

vulture 𓈖𓏏𓂋𓏯𓅭 ⲛⲟϣⲉⲣ = vulture n-sh-r 𓅐
nattura 𓈖𓇑𓇑𓏏𓇳 (𐦌NE 𓇓shu 出chū 屮chè 子zi)
nature 𓈖𓏏𓊖

The coherence of Mother Nature 𓈖𓏏𓂋𓏯𓅐 is so striking that a new light should be shined on Egyptian Hieroglyphs and the internationally connected Brotherhood, as depicted in the Armana letters.

Old etymology of this Eurasian female principle “Nature” may be the pronoun ante-she 𓈖𓏏𓋴. Versus Neuter and 𓊹 Andro, Indra, ante-su𓈖𓏏𓇓!

The following goddesses, which have previously been treated as separate, are probably just renderings of the same goddess:
Nature 𓈖𓏏𓂋𓏯𓅐
Neith 𓈖𓏏𓏯𓆗 Natter(snake)
Neith 𓈖𓏏𓋋𓆗 Nessie;)
Neith 𓋋 𓋌
Nut 𓏌𓏏𓇯𓀭 Nurtair
Tefnut 𓏏𓆑𓈖𓏏 Deva Nuta | Theia Phonit
Nut 𓏌𓏌𓏏𓏌𓇯𓁐 Nurture full rendering𓏌
𓅆 HorNeith 𓇇𓆤 North 𓋔
Shubit 𓅭𓅭𓆤𓆤𓏏𓀭 Jupiter?

male counterpart:
𓋊 Menes 𓋉 Khmin 𓃝 Khmun
see 𓃝 Hieros gamos𓐍𓈖𓌰𓅓𓏏𓂉𓁐

𓅐 Mother Nature brings together the Semitic, Hamitic and Japhetic branches of mankind.
𓅐 Heb nesher, Syr neshra, JNA nishra, Amh neser, Tig neser, Uga nshr
𓅐 Ind nasar, Per nasr, Akk nashru (eagle) 𓆂

Nashru 𓈖𓂋𓆂𓂡 see human race vs rage 𓂋𓍿𓏏𓀀

MooTaur: 𓏠𓈖𓇋𓅱‎ 母牛 mǔniú 𓈖𓂋𓅐𓃒𓏤 Mutterkuh
Mutter Hathor 𓉗𓏏𓉐 𓉡 𓎛𓊨𓏏 Heather 𓉠 𓋧 𓂓𓏤𓊪𓏏𓎛𓀭 “Hüterin”

𓂋𓈖𓏏𓏌𓏏𓆘 «Ernūtet» Ernte (Harvest) Renenutet
